report_title: Oil Field Drilling Services in the US
executive_summary: Figures have been adjusted for inflation and are presented in 2023 currency. The industry provides support services on a fee or contract basis to companies involved in oil extraction, mining and quarrying. Since the extraction of hydrocarbons dwarves that of any other mineral or energy source in the United States, most oil field drilling service companies are concerned with providing support services strictly to oil companies. Due to this relationship, the industry is exposed to numerous endogenous and exogenous factors that factor into the success of the Oil Drilling and Gas Extraction industry (IBISWorld report 21111). For example, rising hydrocarbon prices often yield an increase in demand for oil field drilling services as previously unprofitable sites become attractive to producers. Still, as prices dip, demand for oil field drilling services may recede as producers become more cautious regarding extracting resources in a low-priced environment and limit drilling to only the most profitable fields. Industry revenue has plummeted at a CAGR of 7.8% over the past five years and is expected to total $51.1 billion in 2023, when revenue will fall by an estimated 10.2%.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: The Industry Plays a Vital Role in the Production of Oil
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Companies in the industry provide valuable services to upstream oil companies and sell products that oil field oil field drilling service companies use to explore and develop oil deposits. Similar to upstream oil companies, oil field drilling service companies are highly exposed to fluctuations in crude oil prices, which can be affected by various factors. Demand for oil field drilling services initially benefited over the five years to 2023 as the prices of crude oil increased from decade lows and spurred new drilling activity. Still, revenue gains quickly sputtered out upon the emergence of global socioeconomic restrictions that were implemented to curb the spread of the virus. Ultimately, this led to a collapse in oil demand. Lower crude oil prices and constricted global supply lines have led to lower drilling activity for oil field drilling service companies. Industry profit will decrease due to volatile demand and rising purchase costs.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Despite a Few Prominent Players, the Industry is Still Highly Fragmented With Many Smaller Companies
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: The largest companies in the industry benefit from economies of scale and greater experience working on a wide variety of projects, giving them an advantage over smaller oil field drilling service companies. Although the emergence of hydraulic fracturing, commonly known as fracking and horizontal drilling techniques have spurred higher levels of production and investment in recent years, the industry has also encountered substantial setbacks in the five-year period. Despite exorbitant revenue volatility, there are still plenty opportunities for new businesses to enter the market over the five years to 2023, primarily very small or nonemploying companies. Currently, nonemploying operations are to account for more than half of all companies in the industry. Still, the COVID-19 pandemic led to a substantial decline in industry participation, as many oil field drilling service companies have been forced to leave the industry amid heightened restrictions and economy uncertainty.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: The Industry Will Decline Over The Five Years To 2028
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Strong economic conditions following the height of the COVID-19 led to heightened and sustained inflation. This will lead to a recessionary period, reducing demand from downstream markets. Global economic conditions deteriorate, hindering oil field drilling service companies. Still, the high value-added nature of the industry's services and lack of substitute services support industry performance.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Production remains strong, although increasing environmental concerns will pose a threat
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: The US oil and gas production index, which measures the annual output of oil and gas in the United States, will continue increasing over the five years to 2028. The emergence of hydraulic fracturing and horizontal drilling has been a boon to upstream oil producers and these techniques will continue to sustain demand for oil field drilling services over the next five years. Still, environmental concerns persist moving forward and due to this, tighter regulations will emerge concerning unconventional oil extraction techniques. Also, in accordance with the Biden Administration, regulatory concerns have become more pronounced and the regulatory burden may continue to increase on oil field drilling service companies in the outlook period. Nonetheless, the industry is poised to benefit from growing production levels of domestic oil.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: FLUCTUATIONS IN OIL PRICES AND A RAPIDLY CHANGING REGULATORY ENVIRONMENT INCREASES VOLATILITY
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: When oil prices fall, upstream oil companies often curtail production on their highest-cost extraction sites, which reduces demand for oil field drilling services. Over the next five years, the world price of crude oil will fall, resulting in anticipated reduction in revenue generation. Oil field drilling service companies will make cutbacks on employment due to an anticipated recession. Both industry wages and employment will decrease over the five years to 2028. Also, many states have implemented fracking regulations over the five years to 2023 and this trend will continue in the outlook period. The federal government and Environmental Protection Agency will also likely implement more stringent regulations for fracking and oil emissions. In particular, oil field drilling service companies will be required to use pollution-capture technology, further raising costs. Growing regulations will increase operating costs, preventing large profit gains.

industry_definition: This industry provides oil field services to companies that explore, drill and produce oil.

opportunities: US oil and gas production index

key_trends: As the end of COVID-19 quarantine measures and lockdown restrictions fuels a pent-up demand for travel and other economic activity, aggregate demand for oil will increase. Despite this, the world price of crude oil will endure sharp declines, but will still remain higher than pre-pandemic levels.
Even though oil prices are set to drop, the rate at which this will happen will be relatively subdued, enabling upstream companies to more effectively plan out future projects.

market_segmentation.segment_description: PADD 3 includes the primary oil-producing states of Texas and New Mexico, as well as the Gulf Coast offshore platforms. Texas and Gulf Coast offshore platforms are the primary oil producers within this market.

PADD 2 includes North Dakota and Oklahoma. This market has marginally declined as a share of revenue over the past five years due to falling oil production from North Dakota's Williston Basin, which was especially apparent amid the COVID-19 pandemic and associated slowdowns. This market also includes Cushing, OK, which is the primary storage station for crude oil in the United States.

PADD 4 includes Colorado, Idaho, Montana, Utah and Wyoming. These states drill and produce moderate amounts of crude oil and have relatively low demand for oil field services. Demand from this market has remained relatively steady over the past five years.

PADD 5 includes Alaska and California, two major oil-producing states in the United States. California is home to Chevron Corporation and several oil refineries, thereby resulting in steady demand for oil field services. Demand from this market has decreased over the past five years.

PADD 1 includes the East Coast states of Florida, New York, Pennsylvania, Virginia and West Virginia. This market is minuscule due to the low level of oil production and extraction in the states. Over the past five years, this market's share of revenue has remained relatively stable.

products_and_services.product_description: Services include drilling oil wells, directional drilling control, hydraulic fracturing, extraction of hydrocarbons and crude petroleum and reworking oil wells.

products_and_services.product_or_service: Production, Installation, Maintenance and Repair Services
products_and_services.product_description: Services in this segment include installing oil production equipment, including wellhead fittings, pumps and engines, pumping oil wells, along with repairing and maintaining all equipment used by customers.
Oil field drilling service companies in this segment also provide technical support for customers.

demand_determinants.determinant_description: The world price of crude oil directly affects oil extraction activity and this affects demand for support services. Rising crude oil prices often lead to increased demand for oil drilling and extraction.

demand_determinants.determinant_title: US Oil and Gas Production Index
demand_determinants.determinant_description: The US oil and gas production index measures annual fluctuations in oil and gas production. The volume of oil produced in the United States sets demand for this industry's services.

business_locations.location_description: The Southwest region is home to the greatest number of establishments in 2023 due to the number of oil field drilling service companies that are located in Texas. The region is a hydrocarbon powerhouse of the United States. Texas alone is to account for nearly half of all establishments in 2023.

regulations_points.regulation_title: The Clean Water Act (CWA) and the Resource Conservation and Recovery Act (RCRA)
regulations_points.regulation_description: Under the CWA and RCRA, companies are responsible for ensuring that appropriate water and solid waste discharge procedures have been followed. They are also subject to specific provisions relating to airborne pollution emissions.

The CAA is designed to protect and enhance the nation's air resources to protect public health and welfare. It establishes limits to air pollutants, including carbon monoxide, nitrous oxides, sulfur oxides and other particulate matter.

regulations_points.regulation_title: The Comprehensive Environmental Response, Compensation and Liability Act (CERCLA)
regulations_points.regulation_description: The CERCLA regulates the release and remediation of hazardous substances. Companies endure substantial monetary consequences when found in violation of environmental standards.

Companies are governed by laws and regulations relating to workplace safety and worker health. OSHA covers several topics relating to worker safety, including break and meal times, noise levels and dust standards.

barriers_points.barrier_description: Oil field drilling services is highly labor intensive. This industry relies on oilfield workers, petroleum and chemical engineers, research scientists, mineral ore prospectors, drilling specialists and other highly skilled professionals.

basis_points.basis_description: Competitive pricing is key in attracting downstream customers. Oil field drilling service companies must be able to deliver a range of high-quality services.
Offering value-added services is highly important. Oil field drilling service companies tend to have tight profit due to volatile crude oil prices, making differentiation vital to survival.

concentration_points.concentration_title: Low concentration among land service providers
concentration_points.concentration_description: The oil field drilling services industry has a low level of market share concentration. While major players are multinational oilfield services companies, most oil field drilling service companies are small with very limited market share concentration. Concentration is particularly low among companies that supply support services for oil drilling and extraction on land.
Conversely, concentration is higher in the offshore oil extraction services segment since these services have greater capital requirements and fewer support companies serving these operations.

The majority of employing establishments have fewer than 20 workers and over three quarters of establishments employ fewer than 100 workers. Less than a quarter of oil field drilling service companies are large international or national companies that employ more than 500 people.

cost_factors.cost_factor_description: Purchases are required for drilling, acidizing, cementing and other services provided by this industry. Oil field drilling service companies need to purchase material and parts for drill rigs, cement for wells, chemical compounds and other materials.

cost_factors.cost_factor_title: Skilled labor is highly important, resulting in high wage costs
cost_factors.cost_factor_description: This industry heavily relies on oilfield workers, petroleum and chemical engineers, research scientists, mineral ore prospectors, drilling specialists and other highly skilled professionals. Due to the highly specialized nature of most work contracts, wages are a major component of the industry's cost structure.

cost_factors.cost_factor_title: Other costs dominate the industry cost structure
cost_factors.cost_factor_description: Other expenses include research and development costs, administrative expenses, transportation and other miscellaneous expenses. Companies that have the most up-to-date and efficient technology have a major competitive advantage in this industry.

capital_intensity_points.capital_intensity_title: Oil field drilling services is highly labor intensive
capital_intensity_points.capital_intensity_description: This industry relies on oilfield workers, petroleum and chemical engineers, research scientists, mineral ore prospectors, drilling specialists and other highly skilled professionals.

volatility_points.volatility_description: The Oil Field Drilling Services industry exhibited a very high level of revenue volatility over the five years to 2023. Industry revenue is directly linked to oil exploration and production activity, which is influenced by oil price movements.

volatility_points.volatility_title: Volatile world crude prices cause significant demand fluctuations
volatility_points.volatility_description: The world crude price of oil is dependent on global demand and supply. This price is often affected by political conflicts in regions with a high supply of oil. Due to this, prices may fluctuate significantly as tensions rise in a particular oil-rich region.

technological_change_points.technological_change_description: The oil field drilling services industry primarily provides drilling and extraction services such as drilling oil wells, directional drilling control, hydraulic fracturing, extraction of hydrocarbons and crude petroleum, and reworking oil wells.

FAQs.question: How is your company affected by rising imports?
FAQs.answer: Imports in the oil extraction industry affects demands for services of the companies in this industry. However, as the US has become more energy independent over the past decade, domestic companies have benefited.

FAQs.question: Has competition from low-wage countries like China and Mexico impacted your operations?
FAQs.answer: Companies in this industry operate worldwide and competition for specialized and highly complex projects is limited.

FAQs.question: Has your company dealt with volatile input prices over the past few years?
FAQs.answer: Industry revenue moves in line with trends in commodity prices especially price of crude oil. Over the past five years, these commodities have seen very high levels of price volatility, which have generally negatively affected companies.

FAQs.question: Does your company perform research and development to keep up with the latest extraction techniques?
FAQs.answer: Research and Development expenditures are very high in the industry as companies constantly need to innovate to keep up with the demands of oil extractors.

FAQs.question: How is your company using new technology, such as new drilling techniques?
FAQs.answer: Large companies have hundreds of patents and constantly provide innovative techniques for its customers to utilize.

FAQs.question: What technology do you invest in to establish an edge over your competitors?
FAQs.answer: Large companies dominate new technological innovation in this industry.

FAQs.question: Have any regulatory expenses significantly impacted your company's profitability recently?
FAQs.answer: Regulation has increased in the industry over the past five years. Due to the new presidential administration, regulations for companies is expected to increase as the press towards renewable energy continues to accelerate.

FAQs.question: How have recent changes to environmental standards impacted your company's operations?
FAQs.answer: Environmental regulation varies on state policies and has increased over the past five years. The current presidential administration is expected to increase regulations on the industry due to its advocacy of green policies.

FAQs.question: How do your company's profit margins compare to your competitors'?
FAQs.answer: Profit has been volatile over the past five years as crude oil prices have swung wildly. The price declines throughout the pandemic have caused further stress to the industry.

FAQs.question: How has input price volatility affected profit margins over the past year?
FAQs.answer: Profit margins vary based on the project that the company undertakes and has remained under pressure over the past five years.

FAQs.question: Do you have a strong reputation with clients? How could you improve your word-of-mouth reputation?
FAQs.answer: Having a high prior success rate (including completed prior contracts). Companies providing oil field drilling services compete on the basis of reputation as well as price.

FAQs.question: Does your company have a reputation for good work practices? How could you increase efficiency?
FAQs.answer: Since companies hire out rigs and crews on an agreed day-rate basis, efficient work practices are needed to ensure that costs do not outstrip revenue.

FAQs.question: How has regulation affected your operations? How closely do you monitor for new regulations?
FAQs.answer: Companies must adhere to several government regulations to ensure safety and environmental sustainability.

FAQs.question: How has the price of oil influenced demand for your services? Have you been able to maintain growth as prices dropped during the pandemic?
FAQs.answer: Rising crude oil prices typically lead to increased demand for oil drilling and extraction. As demand increases, crude oil extractors contract out support services to the Oil Field Drilling Services industry. The COVID-19 pandemic caused extreme levels of price volatility for crude oil. This negative price action has caused steep revenue declines for operators, but given the sustained recovery thus far in crude price.

FAQs.question: With which regulatory bodies do you deal with the most? How has regulation affected your operations?
FAQs.answer: The industry is subject to a wide range of regulations regarding the location of drill rigs and risks associated with drilling and hydraulic-fracturing operations.

FAQs.question: Does your company monitor volumes of oil and gas produced in the United States? How have recent trends affected your company?
FAQs.answer: The US oil and gas production index measures annual fluctuations in oil and gas production. Production has fluctuated amid COVID-19 restrictions, but recovery is slated to occur.
